body:
So I decided to make a topic on everyone's favorite thing. SCHOOL. A.K.A. the #1 reason for my (and many others) inactivity ;_; .

This topic can be used to discuss what you're learning, or sharing your schedule for school or even homework help! 

Sooo here's my school schedule, it's kinda boring because you can't do much as freshman .-.
1st Period- Principles of Arts and AV
2nd- PreAp World Geography
3rd-Theatre 1 (Probably switching to our Theatre Freshman Select Class :D)
4th-Outdoor Education (eZ PE credit xD)
5th- PreAP Geometry 
6th- Lunch <33
7th- French 1
8th- PreAP Biology
9th- PreAP English 1

so feel free to share funny school stories or stuff :)))

replies.body:
I'll break down school how it works for me:

A block is English. I have to work and stuff here. No fun.

B block is 3D ceramics. I can do whatever i want and the teacher comes in baked half the time

C block is math. It's pretty much me and and all my boys in there

Block D is chem. My teacher looks like hitler. Not much else

replies.body:
For my first trimester as a sophomore...

Period 1: 21st Century Music Skills (best class ever)
Period 2: Character and Leadership (basically pre-Sociology)
Period 3: Physical Education (swimming, yey)
Enrichment A / B*: Regular Movies
Lunch C
Period 4: Biology
Period 5: Geometry

*Enrichment is basically a class that fills up the rest of your lunch time, most of them are sorta fun. There's three lunch hours, you have enrichment during two of them and lunch during one.

------------------

@Evocal ... o.o.

How do you keep track of all of that?

replies.body:
First lesson:


When you need to tell someone your name in french, you need to say " J'ai 15 ans"  instead of  " Je suis 15 ans"  


Which sounds extremely weird, its a common mistake I see frequently, just remember that, and everything will be good.... PLS


I was confused when I saw that english peeps say " I am 15 years old instead"  It confused me :P


PLS

replies.body:
Period 1 — Precalculus. The only reason I haven't finished, say, AP Calculus (or something more advanced) by now is because I chose to stay in the lower math classes with all my struggling friends (and because I have no work ethic or motivation).

Period 2 — AP Chemistry. At least stoichiometry — all we've really been doing lately — is easier than connecting concepts with each other in AP Environmental Science, which I took last year. How funny, people are already getting confused in this class...

Period 3 — AP U.S. History. My teacher practically redefines "insane" and "senile". "Don't bet on the Indians, because the Indians always lose." That's literally how he summarized the first few chapters of our textbook. Even so, that's the most sensible thing we've ever heard from him.

Period 4 — Advanced Orchestra. Really wishing I was concertmaster (the "best" violinist of the orchestra who gets to sit in the first, foremost chair), but my potentially biased teacher — as cool of a guy as he otherwise is — seated me behind all the callow Asian freshmen (no racism intended) just because they take private lessons...

Period 5 — AP English. Essentially nothing more than writing impromptu essays and memorizing vocabulary words for weekly quizzes. I would've transferred out by now if I hadn't been forced by my academy to take this class... and if there weren't a couple eye-catching girls here too...

Period 6 — Ceramics. My school closed all AP Computer Science classes for no apparent reason, and this is where most of the people I know flocked to. So far, it's been very liberating; you can take the period off and the teacher wouldn't mind.

Period 2 — AP Chemistry. At least stoichiometry — all we've really been doing lately — is easier than connecting concepts with each other in AP Environmental Science, which I took last year. How funny, people are already getting confused in this class...

Period 3 — AP U.S. History. My teacher practically redefines "insane" and "senile". "Don't bet on the Indians, because the Indians always lose." That's literally how he summarized the first few chapters of our textbook. Even so, that's the most sensible thing we've ever heard from him.

Period 4 — Advanced Orchestra. Really wishing I was concertmaster (the "best" violinist of the orchestra who gets to sit in the first, foremost chair), but my potentially biased teacher — as cool of a guy as he otherwise is — seated me behind all the callow Asian freshmen (no racism intended) just because they take private lessons...

Period 5 — AP English. Essentially nothing more than writing impromptu essays and memorizing vocabulary words for weekly quizzes. I would've transferred out by now if I hadn't been forced by my academy to take this class... and if there weren't a couple eye-catching girls here too...

Period 6 — Ceramics. My school closed all AP Computer Science classes for no apparent reason, and this is where most of the people I know flocked to. So far, it's been very liberating; you can take the period off and the teacher wouldn't mind.

At my school, we have A day and B day. There's only like a two class difference.
I like school, just starts too early and my school's students are ghetto. .-.

1A: Science
2A: Language Arts
3A: Maths
4A: Physical Education

1B: Social Studies
2B: Language Arts
3B: Maths
4B: Computer Skills (Semester 1, just typing and basic stuff in Microsoft Office)
Gateway Technology (Semester 2, engineering stuff.)

replies.body:
Okay my timetables vary, so ill do 5 best and 5 worst subjects for me:

Best:
1. English
2. Media/Film
3. Creative Writing
4. Digital Music
5. Computer Animation.

Worst:
1. Maths (don't get me started.)
2. Indonesian/LOTE (hate the teacher, not the language)
3. Outdoor Ed. (I just find it boring)
4. Science (Boring & similar reason to #2)
5.Woodwork. (Doesn't interest me and i didn't chose it)

reply_to.body:
At my school, we have A day and B day. There's only like a two class difference.
I like school, just starts too early and my school's students are ghetto. .-.

1A: Science
2A: Language Arts
3A: Maths
4A: Physical Education

1B: Social Studies
2B: Language Arts
3B: Maths
4B: Computer Skills (Semester 1, just typing and basic stuff in Microsoft Office)
Gateway Technology (Semester 2, engineering stuff.)

replies.body: Can someone plz explain me what  a period is? It's like a lesson or so? And how long do you have school? How long each day?
replies.body_tagged: Can someone plz explain me what  a period is? It's like a lesson or so? And how long do you have school? How long each day?

replies.body: Basically, a period is a class, each period usually lasts 45 mins to 2 hours. Each period has different subjects (like science, language arts, etc), different teachers, and classes and teachers. I have school from 8:50 to 3:20, but my bus comes around 8:17. A day lasts 6-8 hours, but occasionally you will have 2 hour early dismissals.
replies.body_tagged: Basically, a period is a class, each period usually lasts 45 mins to 2 hours. Each period has different subjects (like science, language arts, etc), different teachers, and classes and teachers. I have school from 8:50 to 3:20, but my bus comes around 8:17. A day lasts 6-8 hours, but occasionally you will have 2 hour early dismissals.

reply_to.body_tagged: Can someone plz explain me what  a period is? It's like a lesson or so? And how long do you have school? How long each day?

replies.body: a period is a class, such as math or science, and at my school we have 9 periods (lunch being one of those periods), and they are 45 minutes each and we have 4 minute passing periods (time to get to each class) which sucks, I have to run from 4th to 5th period .-. I have school from 8:30 am-3:47 pm, no idea why they decided to end it at 3:47 xD.

replies.body:
My school does a block schedule so it switches off everyday. we have every class over the course of two days and every period is twice as long.
Blue days:
PE
Chemistry
Lunch
AP US History
English

Orange Days:
Precalculus
Latin II
Lunch
APUSH again
Drama

Seminar Days:
Seinfeld Seminar
Intro to programming Seminar
